properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 11:10AM CST until January 23 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Little Rock AR
properties.description:
...Periods of Sleet, Snow and Freezing Rain Possible Wednesday
through Wednesday Night...

* WHAT...Snow, sleet and freezing rain.

* WHERE...Portions of western and northern Arkansas, from areas
near Mena to Mt. Ida northward to Harrison and Mountain Home.

* WHEN...From Wednesday morning through Wednesday night.

* ACCUMULATIONS...Minor accumulation of snow and sleet up to inch
inch will be possible in some areas. Up to one quarter of an
inch of ice is possible as precipitation transitions to freezing
rain. Some locally higher ice accruals are possible along the
Arkansas River Valley.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Cold surface temperatures will allow the
snow/sleet and freezing rain to cause some slick spots on area
roadways, especially elevated surfaces such as bridges and
overpasses. Some areas will warm above freezing during the day
Wednesday, while other locations will remain at or below
freezing. Areas that remain at or below freezing will likely see
the highest ice accruals.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Weather Advisory means that periods of snow...sleet...or
freezing rain will cause travel difficulties. Be prepared for
slippery roads and limited visibilities...and use caution while

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM WEDNESDAY TO 6 AM CST THURSDAY
